Articles.Content:
Hi errbody! Firstly, I search for a similar thread and didnt see one so im making a new post =P

I wanted to see if it were possible to make an effective lifting wing with camber (the best kerbal scientists can provide any how). What I was thinking involved a lot of wing panels (and lift hopefully) so I aimed for a cargo plane that could haul a Jumbo 64 fuel tank... the heaviest thing in KSP!

For no other reason than awesome I decided to try and make Boeings X-48 BWB concept plane to test the idea!! Also, only using the jet engines and seperate fuel, the Jumbo is cargo only

Frame concept

Wing outline

Wing internal structure

Changed/added structure & engines / gear

Added fuel and some skin

First rendition complete!!!

Final version (yes, the underside looks just as awesome)

It flies!!! The best I could get out of it was 19k alt and 850km/h Why is it always dark!?

Boeing X-48 model:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/bwb-heavy-lifter-prototype/

Greats success! Next project? BWB that fits 12 Jumbos! and I'd attach the save file but idk how AND I tried posting the screens but that didnt work either.. so you have links now 8( (NVM! thanks Hodo!)

Edited October 25, 2013 by JNC

Hi errbody! Firstly, I search for a similar thread and didnt see one so im making a new post =P

I wanted to see if it were possible to make an effective lifting wing with camber (the best kerbal scientists can provide any how). What I was thinking involved a lot of wing panels (and lift hopefully) so I aimed for a cargo plane that could haul a Jumbo 64 fuel tank... the heaviest thing in KSP!

For no other reason than awesome I decided to try and make Boeings X-48 BWB concept plane to test the idea!! Also, only using the jet engines and seperate fuel, the Jumbo is cargo only

In imageshack if you right click on the image in your gallery and select "Share" it will give you the forum code to post it.

Or you can add

There is a pic of your craft, your last one I believe.

tip 1: use http://imgur.com/ for image uploads, they give you a link you can paste directly to forum posts.

tip 2: use https://mega.co.nz/ for posting .crafts, it's free, doesn't require registration and will remember what you have uploaded.

Comment: Awesome job man, especially getting it airborne in one piece haha, don't think i've made planes with such a large partcount, and to such detail.
That is one good looking bird! Awesome job!

Main reason for all the structure is 1: support for the jumbo weight (especially if i do 12) and 2: gives me a place to put all the wing panels! 12 Jumbo's = 432 weight so I'll need about that many wings hahaha *sigh*
